meanings.definition: A photomechanical process for making prints from a plate coated with a gelatin film containing pigment.
meanings.sent1: The artist used collotype to create beautiful prints of flowers.
meanings.sent2: I bought a collotype of a famous painting to hang in my living room.
meanings.sent3: The collotype machine seemed to have a mind of its own, printing pictures of cats everywhere.
meanings.sent4: Her memories were like collotypes, vivid and detailed, capturing every moment.
meanings.sent5: The collotype print of the sunset was so realistic, it felt like you could step into it.

meanings.definition: A print made using the collotype process.
meanings.sent1: The collotype displayed in the gallery was truly stunning.
meanings.sent2: She collected rare collotypes from different artists around the world.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat knocked over the collotype, leaving ink paw prints everywhere.
meanings.sent4: His words were like a collotype, leaving a lasting impression on everyone who heard them.
meanings.sent5: The collotype of the city skyline captured every detail, from the tallest skyscraper to the smallest window.
